Text: The term heliophysics means "physics of the Sun" (the prefix "helio", from Attic Greek "hḗlios", means Sun), and appears to have been used only in that sense until quite recently.

Text: Heliophysics:  The term was adopted in Siscoe's restricted sense by the NASA Science Mission Directorate to denote the study of the heliosphere and the objects that interact with it—most notably planetary atmospheres and magnetospheres, the solar corona, and the interstellar medium.
